A **hobbit mummy**, M, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack") and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"). It is a mummified [hobbit](/wiki/Hobbit "Hobbit") that will seek out and collect [gold](/wiki/Gold "Gold") and [gems](/wiki/Gem "Gem").

A hobbit mummy has a single claw attack that can induce [withering](/wiki/Withering "Withering").

## Generation

Hobbit mummies have a 6⁄7 chance of [being generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") a [mummy wrapping](/wiki/Mummy_wrapping "Mummy wrapping").

A hobbit mummy leaves behind an aged hobbit [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") upon death.

## Encyclopedia entry

But for an account of the manner in which the body was  
bandaged, and a list of the unguents and other materials  
employed in the process, and the words of power which were  
spoken as each bandage was laid in its place, we must have  
recourse to a very interesting papyrus which has been edited  
and translated by M. Maspero under the title of Le Rituel de  
l'Embaumement. ...  
Everything that could be done to preserve the body was now  
done, and every member of it was, by means of the words of  
power which changed perishable substances into imperishable,  
protected to all eternity; when the final covering of purple  
or white linen had been fastened upon it, the body was ready  
for the tomb.  
\[ Egyptian Magic, by E.A. Wallis Budge ]

- *This page is a **[stub](/wiki/Category:Stubs "Category:Stubs")**. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by [**expanding this page**.](https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Hobbit_mummy\&action=edit)*

html:
Hobbit mummy

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
M hobbit mummy (No tile)
Difficulty 6
Attacks Claw 1d6 withering
M hobbit mummy (No tile)
Difficulty 6
Attacks

Claw 1d6 withering

Base level 5
Base experience 31
Speed 10
Base AC 5
Base MR 20
Alignment -4 (chaotic)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 850
Nutritional value 75
Size Medium
Resistances cold,sleep,poison,level drain
Resistances conveyed None

A hobbit mummy:

  • does not breathe.
  • is mindless.
  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • is poisonous to eat.
  • does not eat. (*)
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • likes gold.
  • likes gems.
  • has infravision.
  • never leaves a corpse.
Reference EvilHack - monst.c, line 2174

A hobbit mummy, M, is a type of monster that appears in EvilHack and Hack'EM. It is a mummified hobbit that will seek out and collect gold and gems.

A hobbit mummy has a single claw attack that can induce withering.

Generation

Hobbit mummies have a 6⁄7 chance of being generated with a mummy wrapping.

A hobbit mummy leaves behind an aged hobbit corpse upon death.

Encyclopedia entry

But for an account of the manner in which the body was
bandaged, and a list of the unguents and other materials
employed in the process, and the words of power which were
spoken as each bandage was laid in its place, we must have

l'Embaumement. ...
Everything that could be done to preserve the body was now
done, and every member of it was, by means of the words of
power which changed perishable substances into imperishable,
protected to all eternity; when the final covering of purple
or white linen had been fastened upon it, the body was ready
for the tomb.
[ Egyptian Magic, by E.A. Wallis Budge ]

A '''hobbit mummy''', {{green|M}}, is a type of [[monster]] that appears in [[EvilHack]] and [[Hack'EM]]. It is a mummified [[hobbit]] that will seek out and collect [[gold]] and [[gem]]s.

A hobbit mummy has a single claw attack that can induce [[withering]].

==Generation==
Hobbit mummies have a {{frac|6|7}} chance of [[Monster starting inventory|being generated with]] a [[mummy wrapping]].

A hobbit mummy leaves behind an aged hobbit [[corpse]] upon death.
